intro: Tridentea marientalensis subsp. marientalensis, commonly known as the Mariental thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and large, pale blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
